item.title: Why Don't We Have Princess Leia Holograms Yet?
item.description: August 26, 2017 - Researchers continue to chase down the sci-fi holy grail of genuine free-standing holograms — and they're getting pretty close. One obstacle: Current computing systems just aren't up to it.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 26, 2017 - Researchers continue to chase down the sci-fi holy grail of genuine free-standing holograms — and they're getting pretty close. One obstacle: Current computing systems just aren't up to it. http://www.npr.org/sections/alltechconsidered/2017/08/26/546084473/why-don-t-we-have-princess-leia-holograms-yet

item.title: Human Rights Watch Raises Concerns Over Autonomous Weapons
item.description: August 26, 2017 - NPR's Scott Simon talks to Bonnie Docherty, senior arms researcher at Human Rights Watch, about the group's call for a pre-emptive ban on fully autonomous weapons.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 26, 2017 - NPR's Scott Simon talks to Bonnie Docherty, senior arms researcher at Human Rights Watch, about the group's call for a pre-emptive ban on fully autonomous weapons. http://www.npr.org/2017/08/26/546323236/human-rights-watch-raises-concerns-over-autonomous-weapons

item.title: Will Samsung Case Mark A Turning Point For South Korean Business Ties To Government?
item.description: August 25, 2017 - After Lee Jae-yong's conviction for bribery, "I hope this is a starting point to cutting off businesses' close relationship to the government," said South Korean President Moon Jae-in's spokesman.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 25, 2017 - After Lee Jae-yong's conviction for bribery, "I hope this is a starting point to cutting off businesses' close relationship to the government," said South Korean President Moon Jae-in's spokesman. http://www.npr.org/sections/parallels/2017/08/25/546041137/will-samsung-case-mark-a-turning-point-for-south-korean-business-ties-to-governm

item.title: YouTube Stars Stress Out, Just Like The Rest Of Us
item.description: August 24, 2017 - Young YouTube stars work hard to look authentic and accessible, and they can make millions of dollars doing it. But the pressure to appear perfect while living online can sometimes be too much.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 24, 2017 - Young YouTube stars work hard to look authentic and accessible, and they can make millions of dollars doing it. But the pressure to appear perfect while living online can sometimes be too much. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/08/24/545552788/youtube-stars-stress-out-just-like-the-rest-of-us

item.title: Tanzania Gears Up To Become A Nation Of Medical Drones
item.description:
August 24, 2017 - Drones have delivered everything from pizza to condoms to hot dogs. In Tanzania, they have a bold new mission.
- http://www.npr.org/sections/goatsandsoda/2017/08/24/545589328/tanzania-gears-up-to-become-a-nation-of-medical-drones
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 24, 2017 - Drones have delivered everything from pizza to condoms to hot dogs. In Tanzania, they have a bold new mission. http://www.npr.org/sections/goatsandsoda/2017/08/24/545589328/tanzania-gears-up-to-become-a-nation-of-medical-drones

item.title: Justice Department Narrows Request For Visitor Logs To Inauguration Protest Website
item.description: August 23, 2017 - Dropping a request for some 1.3 million IP addresses, the Trump Administration says it will instead focus "on evidence of the planning coordination and participation in a criminal act."
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 23, 2017 - Dropping a request for some 1.3 million IP addresses, the Trump Administration says it will instead focus "on evidence of the planning coordination and participation in a criminal act." http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/08/23/545515159/justice-department-narrows-request-for-visitor-logs-to-inauguration-protest-webs

item.title: #HappyBirthday: Quintessential Twitter Feature Turns 10
item.description: August 23, 2017 - Originally envisioned as a method of organization, the hashtag has gone from an obscure idea to an indelible part of our communication landscape.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 23, 2017 - Originally envisioned as a method of organization, the hashtag has gone from an obscure idea to an indelible part of our communication landscape. http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/08/23/545604420/-happy-birthday-twitters-signature-feature-turns-ten

item.title: Walmart, Google Join Forces In Online Fight Against Amazon
item.description: August 23, 2017 - The world's largest retailer will hawk its products on Google Express for the first time, in a play to get a bigger chunk of the growing voice-enabled shopping market currently dominated by Amazon.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 23, 2017 - The world's largest retailer will hawk its products on Google Express for the first time, in a play to get a bigger chunk of the growing voice-enabled shopping market currently dominated by Amazon. http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/08/23/545482081/walmart-google-join-forces-in-online-fight-against-amazon

item.title: Unlikely Allies Join Fight To Protect Free Speech On The Internet
item.description: August 23, 2017 - After big tech companies took action to take down white supremacist content, there have been calls for the government to step in to protect free speech from the right and left.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 23, 2017 - After big tech companies took action to take down white supremacist content, there have been calls for the government to step in to protect free speech from the right and left. http://www.npr.org/sections/alltechconsidered/2017/08/23/545320833/unlikely-allies-join-fight-to-protect-free-speech-on-the-internet

item.title: New Bullet Trains To Put China Out Front On High-Speed Rail
item.description: August 22, 2017 - Six years after China slowed down its fastest trains in the wake of a deadly crash, a next generation of super-fast trains are set to cut commute times between major cities.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 22, 2017 - Six years after China slowed down its fastest trains in the wake of a deadly crash, a next generation of super-fast trains are set to cut commute times between major cities. http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/08/22/545279475/new-bullet-trains-to-put-china-out-front-on-high-speed-rail

item.title: 'Smart' Pill Bottles Aren't Always Enough To Help The Medicine Go Down
item.description: August 22, 2017 - Lots of people forget to take their medicine on time. Now firms are selling "smart" pill bottles that send patients reminders through the Internet. But maybe the real problem isn't forgetfulness.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 22, 2017 - Lots of people forget to take their medicine on time. Now firms are selling "smart" pill bottles that send patients reminders through the Internet. But maybe the real problem isn't forgetfulness. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/08/22/538153337/smart-pill-bottles-arent-enough-to-help-the-medicine-go-down

item.title: Uber Hires Harvard Business School's Frances Frei To Address Leadership Issues
item.description: August 21, 2017 - NPR's Ari Shapiro speaks with Uber's new vice president of leadership and strategy about what she plans to bring to the ride-hailing company after more than a dozen executives left this year.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 21, 2017 - NPR's Ari Shapiro speaks with Uber's new vice president of leadership and strategy about what she plans to bring to the ride-hailing company after more than a dozen executives left this year. http://www.npr.org/2017/08/21/545071297/uber-hires-harvard-business-schools-frances-frei-to-address-leadership-issues

item.title: Russian Bots Tweeting Calls To Fire McMaster, Former FBI Agent Says
item.description: August 20, 2017 - An online tracker developed by former FBI agent Clint Watts has identified Russian bots as responsible for many tweets urging the firing of National Security Adviser H.R. McMaster.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 20, 2017 - An online tracker developed by former FBI agent Clint Watts has identified Russian bots as responsible for many tweets urging the firing of National Security Adviser H.R. McMaster. http://www.npr.org/2017/08/20/544817844/russian-bots-tweeting-calls-to-fire-mcmaster-former-fbi-agent-says

item.title: Is AI More Threatening Than North Korean Missiles?
item.description: August 18, 2017 - Tesla CEO Elon Musk last week warned that AI is an enormous threat. There can be no doubt that the advent of smart, rather than smart-ish, machines, is a long way off, though, says blogger Alva Noë.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 18, 2017 - Tesla CEO Elon Musk last week warned that AI is an enormous threat. There can be no doubt that the advent of smart, rather than smart-ish, machines, is a long way off, though, says blogger Alva Noë. http://www.npr.org/sections/13.7/2017/08/18/544061771/is-ai-more-threatening-than-north-korean-missiles

item.title: Tech Companies Blacklist White Supremacist Site
item.description:
August 18, 2017 - The neo-Nazi website The Daily Stormer has been essentially purged from the Internet following the white supremacist violence in Charlottesville.
- http://www.npr.org/2017/08/18/544365040/tech-companies-blacklist-white-supremacist-site
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
